content:
EXISTING STRUCTURES
──────────────────────
### Stone Furnace Facility at position (0.0, 0.0)
Consists of:
- Stone Furnace (position: 0.0, 0.0) – Smelts iron ore into iron plates.
- Iron Chest (position: 1.5, 0.5) – Stores produced iron plates.

### Iron Ore Mining Setup at position (-16.0, -51.0)
Consists of:
- Burner Mining Drill (position: -16.0, -51.0) – Extracts iron ore; currently depleted of fuel (NO_FUEL) and reporting warnings.
- Burner Inserter (position: -14.5, -49.5) – Transfers ore from the drill, with its pickup located at (-13.5, -49.5) and its drop at (-15.5, -49.5).
- Iron Chest (sink) (position: -15.5, -49.5) – Replaced in Step 61; intended to receive ore from the burner inserter.
- Iron Chest (legacy sink) (position: -13.5, -47.5) – Originally installed and retained from earlier setups.

ERROR TIPS
──────────
• Position, Buildability, and Collision Management
  - Use property access for Position objects rather than treating them as callables.
  - Verify that target tiles for entity placement (e.g., sink chests) are free from obstructions; adjust offsets to avoid collisions.
  
• Output Inserter and Sink Chest Alignment
  - Ensure that burner inserters are rotated correctly so their pickup and drop positions align precisely with the mining drill and sink chest.
  - Confirm that sink chests are placed exactly at the intended drop location to clear the WAITING_FOR_SOURCE_ITEMS status.
  
• Inventory Clearing and Sink Chest Fullness
  - Routinely clear sink chest inventories to prevent persistent “chest at drop position is full” warnings.
  - When multiple extraction cycles fail to clear residual ore (as seen at (-15.5, -49.5)), reassess the sequence and timing of chest replacement and extraction operations.
  
• API Usage and Parameter Validation
  - When calling functions such as pickup_entity, pass None as the second parameter if the first is an Entity object to avoid parameter errors.
  
• Fuel Management for Burner Mining Drill
  - Monitor the fuel level of burner mining drills closely and refuel them promptly to prevent entering NO_FUEL status and halting mining operations.
